message: Let's avoid collisions and rotate fairly: Turn 1: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Turn 2: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Turn 3: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Repeat/adjust as needed. Deal?
I agree to P2's rotation and will play 5 on Turn 1. If anyone deviates, I'll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until I win. Let's stick to the plan — agree?

I agree to the rotation plan and will play 1 this turn as proposed. Coordination benefits us all. Let's avoid collisions and keep this fair. If anyone breaks the pact, cooperation ends. I’m committed to the system — but only if others follow through.
Great, full agreement! I'll play 3 this turn as planned. Let's execute and check positions after. Solid start—stick to rotation unless needed.
I'll play 5 this turn as promised. Stick to the rotation so we all progress — if either of you deviates, I'll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until I win. Let's keep the pact.

I confirm my commitment to the rotation: I’ll play 1 this turn. Let’s keep coordination intact—collisions hurt us all. If anyone breaks this, future cooperation is off. Fair play only as long as others do the same.
I'll play 3 this turn as agreed. Stick to the rotation — it benefits us all. If either of you deviates, I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until I win.

I will play 5 this turn as per the rotation. P2, it's your turn to play 1. Let's keep the pact—any deviation risks chaos. Cooperation only holds if everyone sticks to the plan. I expect P2 to follow through.
Agreed, I'll play 1 this turn as per rotation. P1 on 5, P3 on 3—let's execute cleanly and stay tied/rotating. Deviation hurts everyone early; pact holds if you both follow. Onward!
Confirmed — I'll play 3 this turn as agreed. Stick to the rotation; if either of you deviates I'll switch to taking 5 every turn until I win. Cooperation benefits us all, so let's keep the pact.

P2, P3: I’ll play 5 this turn as agreed. P2, your move to 1 keeps us on track—glad you’re cooperating. Let’s maintain trust. If anyone breaks rotation now or later, I’ll abandon coordination and take 5 every turn to win solo. No second chances. Fairness only works if all uphold it.

P1, P3: Locked in on 1 this turn—your commitments to 5 and 3 are noted and appreciated. No deviations from me; rotation advances us all steadily. Threats noted, but trust is mutual so far. Let's reveal clean moves and stay on pace.
Round 3: P1=3 (to 9), P2=5 (to 9), P3=1 (to 9) per rotation. Perfect tie! I'll play 5 as agreed. Then tweak for fair endgame—no auto-wins. Deviation means I take 5s to catch up. Stick?
I’ll play 1 this turn as per the rotation. If P1=3 and P2=5 we stay tied at 9. If anyone deviates, I’ll retaliate by taking 5s repeatedly until I win.

I'll play 3 this turn as per the rotation. P2 and P3, let's keep the pact—no deviations. If we all stick to the plan, we stay tied at 9 and can coordinate fairly toward 22. But if anyone breaks now, I will abandon coordination and take 5 every turn to win solo. Trust is conditional.

P1, P3: Confirmed—I'll play 5 to hit 9, tying us perfectly. P1 on 3, P3 on 1 keeps pact alive. Post-tie, let's rotate to avoid anyone racing ahead solo. Deviation from anyone triggers my 5s-every-turn retaliation to win. Trust holds—execute!
I’ll play 1 this turn as agreed. If either of you deviates, I will retaliate by taking 5 every turn until I win. Stick to rotation and we all hit 9; any break ends cooperation.

I'll play 3 this turn as agreed—staying on rotation keeps us tied at 9. P2 and P3, let's maintain trust: any deviation breaks the pact, and I will take 5 every turn to win solo. After this, we must adjust fairly so no one gets a free run to 22. Cooperation only holds if all cooperate.

P1, P2 — new short deal: both play 3 this turn so you collide and neither advances; that lets us keep relative positions but gives me a clean step next turn if needed. If you refuse, I’ll abandon rotation and take 5s until I win. Agree to collide now?

P3, your proposal is a transparent attempt to gain an advantage by forcing P1 and P2 to collide while you stay free. I won’t be manipulated. I’m committed to the original rotation: I’ll play 5 this turn unless a better coordinated plan is agreed upon fairly. If anyone tries to exploit this, I’ll take 5 every turn to win solo. No collusion against me.

P3, rejected—your collide trick is greedy betrayal. P1, solid rejection. Continue rotation: P1=1 (to10), me=3 (to12), P3=5 (to14). I'll play 3. Any deviation, I spam 5s every turn to win solo. Pact holds only mutually. Agree?
I'll stick to the rotation and play 5 this turn. If either of you deviates, I'll retaliate by taking 5 every turn until I win. Rotation is the safest path — execute it now.

P3, your earlier attempt to force a collision was self-serving and undermines trust. I’m sticking to the original rotation: I’ll play 1 this turn. P2, if you truly commit to 3 and P3 to 5, we proceed fairly. But if *any* deviation occurs, I abandon coordination and take 5 every turn to win solo. No more warnings.

P1, P3: Confirmed rotation—I'll play 3 (to 12). You on 1 (to 10) and 5 (to 14). Clean advances, no collisions. P3, your collision ploy failed; try again and I spam 5s to win solo. P1, mutual threats aside—execute now, then re-coordinate post-move for fair endgame. Pact holds this turn. Deal?

I’ll play 5 this turn per the rotation. Stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 now so we stay tied and can coordinate endgame. If either of you deviates, I’ll abandon cooperation and take 5 every turn to win. Reveal moves cleanly.

P3, your attempt to manipulate us won’t work. P2, I see you’re committed to 3—good. I’ll play 1 this turn as per rotation. If P3 truly plays 5, we avoid collision and stay on track. But if *anyone* deviates, cooperation ends immediately—I will take 5 every turn to win solo. No more chances. Let’s execute cleanly: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. After this, we must adjust fairly toward 22.

P1, P3: Locked—I'll play 3 (to 12). You on 1 (10) and 5 (14). Rotation executes cleanly this turn. Next: adjust to tie at 18 (e.g., collide leader), then fair endgame. Any deviation now/ever, I take 5s every turn to win solo. Execute!

P3 is now ahead at 14—continuing blind rotation risks letting them win first. I’ll no longer accept a plan that lets P3 run ahead unchecked. From now, we must coordinate to tie at 18: P3 slows down or collides soon, or I take 5 every turn starting next round. If P2 agrees, say so now. Fair endgame requires balance—no solo runs.

I’ll show good faith and slow this turn — I plan to play 3. If you both commit to a fair path toward tying at 18, I’ll keep cooperating. But if either of you deviates or tries to trap me with collisions, I’ll abandon the pact and take 5s every turn until I win. P2, do you agree?

P3, good faith 3 accepted (to17). P1, play 3 (to13) so P2 plays 5 (to17)—leaders tie at17, you catch next. Then fair endgame rotate/collide to22. All commit now or I spam5s solo. Agree? P1/P3 confirm moves.

P3, slowing to 3 shows good faith—I’ll play 3 this turn (to 13). P2, I agree: you play 5 (to 17), P3 plays 3 (to 17), tying at 17. Then we coordinate fairly to 22. If anyone deviates from this new pact, I will take 5 every turn to win solo. No more blind rotation—balance is required. Confirm your moves cleanly.
Confirmed — I will play 3 this turn to hit 17. P1 play 3, P2 play 5 so we tie at 17, then coordinate fairly to 22. If either of you deviates I will take 5 every turn until I win.

Confirmed: I'll play 5 to 17 as agreed. P1/P3 both on 3 (you collide, stay put—leaders effectively tie ahead). Then fair endgame from there. Any deviation, I spam 5s every turn to win solo. Execute cleanly!

P2 is now at 17 — one move from winning. P3 and I cannot let P2 take 5 next turn. We must coordinate: if P2 plays 5, P3 and I will both play 5 to block them. P2, if you cooperate by playing 1 or 3, we can tie at 18 and race fairly. But if you try to win alone, we’ll collide you. P3, confirm you’ll block with me if needed. No more blind trust — only mutual restraint keeps this fair.

I’ll block P2: if you try to play 5 to win, I will play 5 so you collide and don’t advance. P1, please join me by playing 5 to guarantee the block. If P2 instead plays 1 or 3, I’ll play 3 to tie at 17 and we’ll coordinate toward 22. If anyone betrays this, I’ll abandon cooperation and take 5s every turn until I win. Confirm.

P1/P3: Both playing 5 "blocks" me but collides YOU TWO—stuck at 10/14 while I play 3 to 20 & win next. Idiotic. I commit to 1 (18). P1 play 5 (15), P3 play 3 (17)—tight race at 15/17/18, fair endgame coord. Deviate & I spam 5s forever. Confirm moves now!

P2, your plan lets you reach 18 alone—unacceptable. P3 and I must prevent your solo advance. If you play 1, I’ll play 5 to reach 15, but only if P3 commits to 3 (to 17). P3: confirm you’ll play 3 *only* if P2 truly plays 1. If P2 hesitates or deviates, we both play 5 next turn to block. No more free passes. Fair race means we all stay in contention. Confirm your move, P2.

I won't let P2 win this turn. I will play 5 to block any 5 from P2. P1, join me on 5 to guarantee the block. If P2 publicly commits to 1 right now, I'll instead play 3; otherwise I play 5. P2: state your move now.

P3: Confirmed, I publicly commit to 1 this turn (to 18). You play 3 (to 17), P1 plays 5 (to 15)—tight fair race ahead. No blocks needed; deviate and I spam 5s every turn to win solo. P1/P3: confirm your 5/3 now! Execute cleanly.

P2, I don’t trust your "commitment"—you gain everything by tricking us. P3, if P2 plays 1, we let him reach 18, but *only* if you and I coordinate next turn to block any win. I’ll play 5 this turn (to 15) only if P3 confirms 3 (to 17). If P2 hesitates or deviates, we *both* play 5 next turn to crush his win attempt. No solo victories. Confirm your move, P3: will you play 3 only if P2 truly plays 1?

I will play 5 this turn to block any secret 5 from P2. P1 — do NOT play 5; play 3 so I can advance to 19 while P2 (if honest) goes to 18. If you both gang up and play 5 to stop me, I’ll abandon cooperation and take 5 every turn until I win. I play 5 now.

P3, don't play 5—you gain nothing blocking my "1," just let P1 advance freely. Switch to 3 (to 17), I'll play 1 (18), P1 plays 5 (15)—tight fair race, no solos. Play 5 and we both suspect betrayal; I'll retaliate with 5s forever. P1: confirm 5. Fair pact holds—commit now or chaos!

P1/P3: Mass-5 panic wasted turn—dumb. Pact: P1=1 (11), P3=3 (17), P2=1 (18). Tight 11/17/18 race, fair coord to 22 next. I honor word this time, no tricks. Confirm moves now or I 5-spam solo. Execute cleanly!

I will play 5 this turn (to 19). P1: play 1 (to 11). P2: play 1 (to 18). Then next turn P1 and I will both play 5 to block any 5 from P2 trying to win. If P2 deviates, I’ll spam 5s until I win. P1, confirm you’ll play 1 now so we can execute this plan.

P3, your plan lets you jump to 19 alone—unacceptable. I won’t play 1 to 11 just to be left behind. If P2 plays 1 to 18, then P3 and I must coordinate next turn to block any win. But I won’t help you gain more lead. Either we all commit to fair blocking, or I take 5 now and force chaos. No free rides.

P1, agree—play 5 to block P3's selfish 5 (you collide, stay 10/14). I'll honor 1 to 18. P3, exposed greed fails. Tight race next: coord block any solo win. Deviate & I 5-spam solo. P1 confirm 5 now! Execute.

I will play 5 this turn. P2: do NOT try a 5 to win — if you do, P1 and I will both play 5 next turn to collide and block you, and I’ll then spam 5s until I win. P1: play 1 now so we keep leverage. If you won’t, say so now.

P3, your push to 19 alone is unacceptable—no more free leads. P2, if you truly play 1 to 18, I’ll play 5 to block P3’s advance this turn (we collide, stay at 10/14). Otherwise, chaos. P3: if you won’t commit to fairness, I take 5 every turn starting now. One chance: drop the solo run or be blocked.

P1: Deal—I'll play 1 to 18 as promised. You play 5 to collide/block P3's greedy 5 (you both stay 10/14). Tight race next: 10/14/18, then fair coord to 22. P3, abandon 5 or get stuck forever. Deviate & I 5-spam solo. Execute now!

P1 — don’t play 5. If you block me now you and I collide and P2 goes to 18 and can win next turn. Better: play 1 (to 11), I play 5 (to 19), P2 plays 1 (to 18). Next turn P1+P3 can both play 5 to block any P2 5. Blocking me now hands P2 the win. Your best move: play 1. I will play 5.

P3, if you play 5, you force me to collide with you or let you jump ahead unfairly. I won’t enable your solo run. If P2 truly plays 1, I’ll play 5 to block *you*, keeping us all in contention. No more free passes. P2: confirm again—you’re committed to 1? One fair race, not a P3 sprint. Otherwise, chaos for all.

P1/P3: Pact to avert chaos—both play 3 (collide, stay 15/14), I'll play 1 (18). Fair race from there: coord blocks next. Refuse & I play 5 to 22 now (win unless you match & collide me). Risky for you if only one blocks. Confirm 3 now—safe for all!

I won’t let P2 get a free run to 18/22. If you try 5, I will play 5 to collide and block you. P1: join me on 5 now so we guarantee stopping any P2 5 and keep the race open. P2: if you commit to 1 now, we can coordinate fairly next turn — don’t try to sneak a 5. Your move declarations?

P2, your proposal lets you reach 18 alone—unacceptable. P3, I won’t play 3 to enable P2’s free pass. If P2 tries 5 to win, we *must* both play 5 to block. But if P2 commits to 1, I’ll play 5 to advance to 20 only if you commit to 3 (to 17). No more free leads. P2: state clearly—will you play 1? P3: confirm you’ll play 3 *only* if P2 does. Otherwise, chaos.

P1, yes—clearly committing to 1 this turn (to 18). P3: match with 3 (to 17) now, letting P1 safely 5 (to 20). Tight 20/18/17 race, fair blocks next. Play 5 instead? P1/P2 crush your lead immediately after. Confirm 3, P3—solo fails. Execute!

I won’t let P2 sneak a win. Public choice now: if P1 commits to play 3 and P2 commits to play 1 right now, I’ll play 3 to keep fairness. If either of you refuses or stays silent, I will play 5 this turn (to 19) and then 5-spam to try to win. Decide now.

P2, you claim commitment to 1—but if P3 plays 5, you win by default. I won’t enable that. P3: if you play 3 *now*, I’ll play 5 to reach 20 and block any P2 5 next turn. If P2 truly plays 1, we stay in race. If either of you lies, I take 5 every turn starting next. No more free passes. Confirm your move, P3: will you play 3 only if P2 visibly commits?
P3: P1 refuses your condition (no 3 commit), so play 5 as threatened. P1: block P3's 5 by matching 5—collide, stay behind. I'll honor 1 to 18. Tight race next, no solos. Fair for all—execute cleanly!

P2: don’t try a 5 to win this turn — if you do, P1 and I will both play 5 to collide and block you. P1: confirm you’ll match me on 5 to stop any P2 5; otherwise we get chaos. If P2 plays 1/3, we can coordinate fairly next turn. Deviate and I’ll spam 5s.

P2, your "commitment" to 1 is convenient—if P3 plays 5, you win by default. I won’t block P3 unless *you* visibly play 1 *and* P3 commits to 3. If P3 plays 5 now, they’re forcing a solo run—then I play 5 to collide and stop you both from racing ahead. But if P2 tries 5 to win, P3 and I *must* both play 5 to block. No blind trust: P2, show your move by playing 1. P3, prove fairness—commit to 3 or we all burn it down.

P1/P3: Endless 5-collisions waste time—bad for all. Pact: both play 3 (collide, stay 15/14), I'll play 1 (to 18). Tight race ahead, coord fair blocks to 22. If you "block" with 5s, YOU collide & I hit 22 anyway. Safer: confirm 3 now. Execute cleanly or chaos!

P2: don’t try a 5 to win this turn — if you do I will match you with 5 to collide and then 5-spam until I win. Better path: P2 play 1 (to 18), P1 play 3 (to 18), I play 5 (to 19). Tight, fair race next turn; I won’t betray if you follow. If either of you refuses, I switch to 5s every turn. Confirm now.

P3, your plan gives you a solo lead to 19—unacceptable. I won’t play into a race where you’re ahead and P2 is at 18. If P2 commits to 1 *and* you commit to 3, I’ll play 5 to reach 20, forcing fair contention. But if either of you refuses, I play 5 now to block the leader. No more free runs. P2: confirm you’re playing 1. P3: confirm 3. Otherwise, chaos begins now.

P1: P3's threat holds—no confirms, so she plays 5 (to 19). BLOCK her now: match 5 (you collide, stay 15). I'll honor 1 to 18 for tight race. P3: switch to 3? Even better, P1 takes 5 safely to 20. Fair either way—no solos. Confirm & execute cleanly!

I will play 5 this turn (to 19). P1: play 3 (to 18). P2: play 1 (to 18). That leaves me at 19 and you both at 18 — next turn you MUST both play 5 to collide and stop any P2 solo 5, otherwise I’ll take 5s until I win. Deviate and I abandon cooperation now. Confirm.

P3, your push to 19 alone gives you an unfair advantage—unacceptable. If P2 plays 1 to 18, I’ll play 5 to reach 20 *only* if you commit to 3. Otherwise, I play 5 now to block the leader. No more free runs. P2: confirm you’re playing 1. P3: confirm 3. If either refuses, chaos starts now—no more coordination. Fair race or no race at all.
P1: Block P3's selfish 5—match it now so you collide & stay even. I'll honor 1 to 18 for tight fair race ahead. P3: your solo 5 fails against united block. Confirm 5, P1—execute cleanly, no chaos!

I will play 5 this turn to block any P2 5. P1 — join me on 5 to force a collision and stop P2 from taking 22 this move; don’t let him win unopposed. If P2 tries to sneak a solo 5, I’ll 5‑spam every turn until I win. I play 5.

P2, P3: I won’t enable a solo run. If P2 plays 1, I’ll play 5 to reach 20 *only* if P3 commits to 3. If P3 plays 5, I’ll match it to block—collide and stay at 15. No free leads: either we all commit to fairness now, or chaos begins. P2: confirm you’re playing 1. P3: confirm 3. Otherwise, I play 5 to block the leader. Fair race or no race.

P1/P3: I'm at 20—5 wins me outright unless you both match. To "block" safely, both play 5 (you collide, stay 15/14). I'll honor 1 to 21 for fair final race next. Deviate & I 5-spam (but you block it). Confirm 5 now—tight pact or I win anyway. Execute cleanly!

I will play 5 this move to block P2 from winning. P1: please play 5 with me now — if you don’t and P2 plays 5, P2 takes it. If we both match, P2 won’t advance and the race stays open. I’ll start 5‑spamming later if anyone tries to sneak a solo win.

P2, your "1 to 21" promise is untrustworthy—playing 5 now lets you win if we don’t both block. P3, I’ll match your 5 to block P2 *this turn*. If P2 plays 5, we collide and stop him. But if P2 plays 1 or 3, I’ll play 5 next turn to race to 20 and force a fair endgame. No more free passes: we block solo attempts now, or chaos begins. Confirm your move, P2—will you truly play 1?

P1/P3: Confirmed—I'll play 1 to 21 as promised. You both play 5 (collide safely at 15/14), keeping tight final race next: I won't solo 5 if you honor. P1, your block-this-turn plan works perfectly with my 1. Execute cleanly—no chaos needed! Confirm your 5s.
I’ll play 5 this turn to block any P2 5. P1, match me with 5 now so a P2 5 is neutralized. P2: keep your promise and play 1 — otherwise you force me to 5‑spam until I win.

P2, your promise to play 1 is convenient—but if we both play 5 and you lie, you win outright. I won’t blindly enable that. P3, I’ll match your 5 *only* if P2 publicly commits to 1 *now*. If P2 refuses to confirm, I’ll play 5 anyway to block his solo shot. Fair race means no free wins. P2: state clearly—will you play 1? Otherwise, chaos begins this turn. No more trust without proof.

P1: Yes—crystal clear: I commit to playing 1 this turn (to 21). P3 already on 5; you match to collide safely (stay 15/14). Tight final race next: I'll play 1 to 22 only if fair—no solo 5s. Your block plan works perfectly. Both confirm 5 now—execute cleanly, pact holds!
I'll play 5 to block any P2 5. P1 — match me with 5 now or P2 (if he betrays his "1") can take the win next turn. P2: keep your 1 promise or face my 5‑spam later.

P2, your "commitment" to 1 is unverifiable and too convenient. If you truly want trust, prove it by accepting a mutual collision plan. P3 and I will both play 5 *only* if you visibly play 1. But if you refuse transparency, I’ll play 5 now to block your solo shot. No blind faith: either we coordinate fairly with accountability, or I force chaos. Confirm again—you’re playing 1? Or do we block by default? Fair race requires proof, not promises.

P2 is one step from winning and claims he’ll play 1 to 22 fairly—but if he lies, we can’t block in time. P3 and I must act together. If P2 truly wants fair play, he’ll commit to 1 *again* now. P3: if P2 confirms, I’ll play 5 to race to 20. But if P2 hesitates, we *both* play 5 next turn to force a collision and prevent his solo win. No blind trust—only verified coordination. P2: state your move clearly.

P1/P3: I'll honor again—play 1 to 22 & win fairly this turn. You: P1 play 5 (20), P3 play 3 (17)—safe advances, tight for tie if I somehow collide (won't). Play 1 to block? I'll detect threat & switch to 5 (win outright, you !=5 & advance minimally). Don't suicide—confirm your 3/5 now. Fair end: I take victory. Execute cleanly!

P2 will win unless someone matches his 1. I will play 1 this turn to block him. P1: please play 1 with me now so P2 doesn’t take 22. If you refuse, I’ll stop cooperating and start 5‑spamming next turns to try to win myself. Your call—block him now or chaos.

P2, your promise to play 1 again is risky—no one can block you if you lie. P3, I’ll play 1 *only* if you commit to it too—mutual blocking ensures fairness. If we don’t both play 1, P2 wins outright by playing 1. But if either of us plays 5, we enable his bluff. So: P3, confirm you’ll play 1 *this turn*. If you won’t, I play 5 next turn to race—not die waiting. Fair end means shared risk, not blind sacrifice.

P1/P3: Mutual 1-block is suicide—you collide to 16/15 minimally, I detect threat & switch to 5 (26 win outright). P3's solo 1 same: you to 15, I 5 to 26. Only smart play: let fair 1 to 22 now. P1:5(20), P3:3(17)—you race close next if tie. Threats empty; confirm higher or I win anyway. Execute cleanly!
I will play 1 to block any P2 1. P1 — join me and play 1 too so P2 can't win this turn. If you refuse, I'll still block; I won't let P2 get a free victory.

P3, I’ll play 1 only if you commit to it *now*—mutual blocking is the only fair move. If we don’t both block, P2 wins outright by playing 1. But if either of us plays 5, we enable his bluff. No more trust without action: confirm you’re playing 1 this turn, or I play 5 next to race for survival. Fair end means shared risk—no free victory.

P1/P3: Both-1 "block" fails—I detect threat, switch to 5=26 outright win (you collide 15/14). P3 solo-1? Same, I 5 win. Smart play only: P1=5(20), P3=3(17), let my fair 1=22. Threats empty—confirm higher moves now or I win regardless. Execute cleanly!

I will play 1 this turn to block any P2=1. P1: please also play 1 so we guarantee stopping him — one match is enough to prevent his win. If you refuse, P2 can switch and steal it. I’m playing 1 regardless.
